document.title: Health K-4 Content Standards with Benchmarks and Performance Standards

CF6EB210DFE601319BD568A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to influence and support others in making health-enhancing choices:

CF6E3B40DFE601319BD468A86D17958E.description: Identify appropriate adults to go to for health issues (e.g., who is a safe adult to go to when you are being bullied).

CF6DD460DFE601319BD368A86D17958E.description: Identify community agencies/resources that advocate for healthy individuals, families, peers and communities:

CF6D8E40DFE601319BD268A86D17958E.description: Be able to express feelings to others (e.g., when they are sick, feel unsafe).

CF6D4870DFE601319BD168A86D17958E.description: Express information and opinions about health issues:

CF6CFF40DFE601319BD068A86D17958E.description: List ways to convey accurate health information and ideas (e.g., storytelling, talking to a health professional).

CF6CB080DFE601319BCF68A86D17958E.description: Describe a variety of methods to convey accurate health information and ideas:

CF6C56C0DFE601319BCE68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to advocate for personal, family, peer and community health. Students will:

CF6C0A60DFE601319BCD68A86D17958E.description: List what personal health goals are appropriate for your age (e.g., wash hands, wear seat belts).

CF6BC0B0DFE601319BCC68A86D17958E.description: Set a personal health goal and track progress toward achievement:

CF6B6A00DFE601319BCB68A86D17958E.description: List consequences of actions (e.g., wearing a seat belt will help avoid injuries if in a car accident).

CF6AF0C0DFE601319BCA68A86D17958E.description: Predict outcomes of positive health decisions:

CF6A9E50DFE601319BC968A86D17958E.description: List examples of when it is appropriate to ask for help in making health-related decisions (e.g., when you are lost, when being bullied);

CF6A5750DFE601319BC868A86D17958E.description: Explain when to ask for assistance in making health-related decisions and setting health goals:

CF6A0EC0DFE601319BC768A86D17958E.description: List steps in the decision-making process.

CF69C490DFE601319BC668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to apply a decision-making process to health issues and problems:

CF697B00DFE601319BC568A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use goal-setting and decision-making skills to enhance health. Students will:

CF68D7A0DFE601319BC368A86D17958E.description: List non-violent strategies to resolve conflict;

CF688EE0DFE601319BC268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate non-violent strategies to resolve conflicts:

CF67E220DFE601319BC068A86D17958E.description: List the differences between negative and positive behaviors; and

CF678AF0DFE601319BBF68A86D17958E.description: Differentiate between negative and positive behaviors used in conflict situations:

CF672F10DFE601319BBE68A86D17958E.description: Identify refusal skills in the areas related to sexuality (e.g., good touch/bad touch); nutrition; alcohol, tobacco and other drug use; physical activity; personal safety; mental, social and emotional well being.

CF66DE70DFE601319BBD68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate refusal skills and explain why they are important to enhance health:

CF668910DFE601319BBC68A86D17958E.description: Recognize when someone is telling you to do something that is wrong.

CF663170DFE601319BBB68A86D17958E.description: Understand when it is appropriate to interrupt for health needs; and

CF65E780DFE601319BBA68A86D17958E.description: Understand the importance of letting people speak without interruption;

CF657970DFE601319BB968A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate attentive listening skills to build and maintain health-enhancing relationships:

CF6529A0DFE601319BB868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to use "I" statements.

CF64DC20DFE601319BB768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate ways to communicate care, consideration and respect of self and others:

CF6492C0DFE601319BB668A86D17958E.description: Identify how to express feelings in a positive way.

CF644170DFE601319BB568A86D17958E.description: Identify feelings associated with different situations (e.g., conflict - frustration/satisfaction; birthday - happy/excited); and

CF63ECA0DFE601319BB468A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate positive ways to express needs, wants and feelings:

CF639950DFE601319BB368A86D17958E.description: Identify actions to help friends make healthy decisions.

CF635140DFE601319BB268A86D17958E.description: List characteristics of behaviors that are healthy; and

CF630AA0DFE601319BB168A86D17958E.description: Describe characteristics needed to be a responsible friend and family member:

CF62C3D0DFE601319BB068A86D17958E.description: Recognize different feelings and the verbal and non-verbal forms of communication associated with them.

CF627BB0DFE601319BAF68A86D17958E.description: Understand that people communicate in different ways; and

CF622EC0DFE601319BAE68A86D17958E.description: Describe the differences between verbal and non-verbal communication;

CF61CAF0DFE601319BAD68A86D17958E.description: Distinguish between verbal and non-verbal communication:

CF6174E0DFE601319BAC68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to use interpersonal communication skills to enhance health. Students will:

CF610E70DFE601319BAB68A86D17958E.description: List health messages that families give in the areas related to sexuality; nutrition; alcohol, tobacco and other drug use; physical activity; personal safety; mental, social and emotional well-being (e.g., what types of snacks you eat at home, stranger danger, family activities).

CF60C1C0DFE601319BAA68A86D17958E.description: Explain how information from school and family influences health:

CF6072B0DFE601319BA968A86D17958E.description: Understand that technology affects how we live.

CF601780DFE601319BA868A86D17958E.description: List the purposes for technology (e.g., convenience, entertainment, selling products, promoting services); and

CF5FC590DFE601319BA768A86D17958E.description: List different forms of technology (e.g., computers, video games, microwaves, cell phones);

CF5F6E30DFE601319BA668A86D17958E.description: Describe ways technology can influence personal health:

CF5F2820DFE601319BA568A86D17958E.description: Understand how media influences feelings and thoughts.

CF5EDC70DFE601319BA468A86D17958E.description: Understand that not all media messages are true; and

CF5E9320DFE601319BA368A86D17958E.description: List the purposes for media (e.g., entertain, sell products, promote services);

CF5E4F20DFE601319BA268A86D17958E.description: List different forms of media (e.g., television, newspaper, magazines, radio);

CF5E0860DFE601319BA168A86D17958E.description: Explain how media influences thoughts, feelings and health behaviors:

CF5DBEC0DFE601319BA068A86D17958E.description: List how the media and culture portray gender roles (e.g., pink=girls, blue=boys, short hair vs. long hair, different toys).

CF5D74F0DFE601319B9F68A86D17958E.description: List similarities and differences in cultures within the community; and

CF5D21C0DFE601319B9E68A86D17958E.description: Describe how cultures within the local community influence personal health behaviors:

CF5CC130DFE601319B9D68A86D17958E.description: Students will analyze the influence of culture, media, technology and other factors on health. Students will:

CF5C7010DFE601319B9C68A86D17958E.description: Practice stress management skills (e.g., daily physical activity, singing, being read to).

CF5BD380DFE601319B9A68A86D17958E.description: List trusted adults to go to when faced with a dangerous situation.

CF5B8B90DFE601319B9968A86D17958E.description: List situations that may be dangerous; and

CF5B41F0DFE601319B9868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate ways to avoid and reduce threatening situations:

CF5AEDB0DFE601319B9768A86D17958E.description: Practice safety rules at home, in school and in the community.

CF5AA360DFE601319B9668A86D17958E.description: Identify substances that are unsafe to touch (e.g., blood, bleach, needles); and

CF5A54F0DFE601319B9568A86D17958E.description: Develop injury prevention and management strategies for personal health:

CF59ECE0DFE601319B9468A86D17958E.description: Identify ways to improve or maintain personal health in the areas related to sexuality; nutrition; alcohol, tobacco and other drug use; physical activity; personal safety; mental, social and emotional well-being (e.g., eat fruits and vegetables, exercise, don't smoke).

CF599790DFE601319B9368A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate strategies to improve or maintain personal health:

CF58ABB0DFE601319B9068A86D17958E.description: Compare behaviors that are safe to those that are risky or harmful:

CF585CB0DFE601319B8F68A86D17958E.description: Identify personal safety rules (e.g., don't push others, playground safety, don't go with strangers).

CF5818C0DFE601319B8E68A86D17958E.description: Recognize the importance of hygiene (e.g., washing hands to avoid colds); and

CF57CD40DFE601319B8D68A86D17958E.description: Identify where to go when you don't feel good (e.g., parent, teacher, school nurse);

CF571680DFE601319B8B68A86D17958E.description: List responsible health behaviors (e.g., washing hands, brushing teeth, exercise);

CF568100DFE601319B8968A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to practice health-enhancing behaviors and reduce health risks. Students will:

CF563A50DFE601319B8868A86D17958E.description: Identify safe adults (e.g., parent, teacher, doctor, dentist, nurse, counselor, appropriate adult).

CF55F290DFE601319B8768A86D17958E.description: Recognize safety officials (e.g., police, fire, security, crossing guard); and

CF55A680DFE601319B8668A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to locate school and community health helpers:

CF5553E0DFE601319B8568A86D17958E.description: Recognize that media messages may be misleading;

CF550C40DFE601319B8468A86D17958E.description: Explain how the media influences the selection of health information, products and services:

CF547550DFE601319B8268A86D17958E.description: Recall own address and phone number; identify safe adults (e.g., parent, teacher, doctor, dentist, nurse, counselor, appropriate adult); and

CF5428B0DFE601319B8168A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to locate resources from home, school and community that provide valid health information:

CF538B00DFE601319B7F68A86D17958E.description: Recognize health-promoting products and services (e.g., food choices, community services, physical activity).

CF534840DFE601319B7E68A86D17958E.description: Identify appropriate adults to talk to regarding health and safety issues; and

CF53DB20DFE601319B8068A86D17958E.description: Recognize safe and unsafe products in the home and community (e.g., bleach vs. milk, used needles);

CF530420DFE601319B7D68A86D17958E.description: Identify characteristics of valid health information and health promoting products and services:

CF52BFD0DFE601319B7C68A86D17958E.description: Students will demonstrate the ability to access valid health information and health promoting products and services. Students will:

CF527A00DFE601319B7B68A86D17958E.description: Describe the importance of taking personal responsibility for actions.

CF522A80DFE601319B7A68A86D17958E.description: List safety rules for different situations (e.g., playground safety, bus safety, classroom rules); and

CF51D5A0DFE601319B7968A86D17958E.description: Identify the benefits of following the directions of health care providers;

CF518F10DFE601319B7868A86D17958E.description: List individuals that can help with detecting and treating childhood injuries and illnesses (e.g., parent, grandparent, teacher, counselor, nurse, doctor);

CF514520DFE601319B7768A86D17958E.description: Identify symptoms of illness (e.g., runny nose, coughing, fever, stomachache, sadness);

CF50ECE0DFE601319B7668A86D17958E.description: Identify health problems that should be detected and treated early and explain how childhood injuries and illnesses can be prevented or treated:

CF50A540DFE601319B7568A86D17958E.description: Name common environmental health issues that affect children in same age group (e.g., second-hand smoke, litter, noise).

CF505000DFE601319B7468A86D17958E.description: Name common emotional health issues of children in same age group (e.g., effects of bullying, when family member is sick, sadness, domestic violence); and

CF4FFE10DFE601319B7368A86D17958E.description: Name common social health issues of children in same age group (e.g., peer pressure, relationships);

CF4FAE40DFE601319B7268A86D17958E.description: Name common physical health issues of children in same age group (e.g., intentional and unintentional injury, personal hygiene);

CF4F5880DFE601319B7168A86D17958E.description: Identify common health issues of children:

CF4F0A80DFE601319B7068A86D17958E.description: Recognize the influences of media and peer pressure on health.

CF4EA350DFE601319B6F68A86D17958E.description: Know how to access help (e.g., dial 911 in an emergency, trusted adult); and

CF4E4810DFE601319B6E68A86D17958E.description: Identify the differences between safe and unsafe situations (e.g., bullying, good touch/bad touch, alcohol, tobacco, other drugs, food contamination, poisonous substances);

CF4E0440DFE601319B6D68A86D17958E.description: Recognize the behaviors that could affect other people (e.g., smoking, drinking, physical activity, nutrition);

CF4DC010DFE601319B6C68A86D17958E.description: Describe how physical, social and emotional environments influence personal health:

CF4D7B40DFE601319B6B68A86D17958E.description: Utilize correct terminology for the human body.

CF4D3450DFE601319B6A68A86D17958E.description: Describe how stress and emotions affect the body systems; and

CF4CE6B0DFE601319B6968A86D17958E.description: Identify the effects of lifestyle choices on body systems (e.g., alcohol, tobacco, other drugs, second-hand smoke, food, physical activity);

CF4C9570DFE601319B6868A86D17958E.description: Describe the basic structure and functions of the human body systems:

CF4C4DE0DFE601319B6768A86D17958E.description: List positive health choices and activities that promote health and help prevent diseases.

CF4C06F0DFE601319B6668A86D17958E.description: Identify the differences between safe and unsafe situations (e.g., bullying, good touch/bad touch, alcohol, tobacco, other drugs, food contamination); and

CF4BBE70DFE601319B6568A86D17958E.description: Identify compassionate behavior and its relationship to diversity (e.g., bullying, disabilities, other special needs);

CF4B2180DFE601319B6368A86D17958E.description: Identify examples of mental, emotional, social and physical health during childhood:

CF4ACE10DFE601319B6268A86D17958E.description: Describe what is meant by good personal hygiene (e.g., describe the importance of hand washing in disease prevention).

CF4A8360DFE601319B6168A86D17958E.description: Describe characteristics of healthy and unhealthy relationships (e.g., describe the unique differences of self and others); and

CF4A2E20DFE601319B6068A86D17958E.description: Describe how personal choices relate to health and how the consequences of those choices affect self and others (e.g., smoking, lack of physical activity, nutrition, personal hygiene, personal safety);

CF49D7E0DFE601319B5F68A86D17958E.description: Identify/describe/understand the relationships between personal health behaviors and individual well-being:

CF497C50DFE601319B5E68A86D17958E.description: Students will comprehend concepts related to health promotion and disease prevention. Students will:
